---
title: Multi-class problem
---



## Libraries


::: {.cell execution_count=1}
``` {.julia .cell-code}
using Pkg; Pkg.activate("docs")
# Import libraries
using Flux, Plots, TaijaPlotting, Random, Statistics, LaplaceRedux
theme(:lime)
```
:::


## Data

::: {.cell execution_count=2}
``` {.julia .cell-code}
using LaplaceRedux.Data
x, y = Data.toy_data_multi()
X = hcat(x...)
y_train = Flux.onehotbatch(y, unique(y))
y_train = Flux.unstack(y_train',1)
```
:::


## MLP

We set up a model

::: {.cell execution_count=3}
``` {.julia .cell-code}
data = zip(x,y_train)
n_hidden = 3
D = size(X,1)
out_dim = length(unique(y))
nn = Chain(
    Dense(D, n_hidden, Ïƒ),
    Dense(n_hidden, out_dim)
)  
loss(x, y) = Flux.Losses.logitcrossentropy(nn(x), y)
```
:::


training:

::: {.cell execution_count=4}
``` {.julia .cell-code}
using Flux.Optimise: update!, Adam
opt = Adam()
epochs = 100
avg_loss(data) = mean(map(d -> loss(d[1],d[2]), data))
show_every = epochs/10

for epoch = 1:epochs
    for d in data
        gs = gradient(Flux.params(nn)) do
            l = loss(d...)
        end
        update!(opt, Flux.params(nn), gs)
    end
    if epoch % show_every == 0
        println("Epoch " * string(epoch))
        @show avg_loss(data)
    end
end
```
:::


## Laplace Approximation

The Laplace approximation can be implemented as follows:

::: {.cell execution_count=5}
``` {.julia .cell-code}
la = Laplace(nn; likelihood=:classification)
fit!(la, data)
optimize_prior!(la; verbose=true, n_steps=100)
```
:::


::: {.cell execution_count=6}
``` {.julia .cell-code}
_labels = sort(unique(y))
plt_list = []
for target in _labels
    plt = plot(la, X, y; target=target, clim=(0,1))
    push!(plt_list, plt)
end
plot(plt_list...)
```
